thread.name: Sync Status - Import Error (Import objects FAILED)

messages.content:
Hello <@846244078575943680> 

I would indeed recommend you to create a branch (synced with git), edit your .infrahub.yml file in it and add your new files transforms into this branch to try them out

I was getting an Import Error after making changes to queries, jinja2_transforms, and artifact_definitions. I thought it might be a dependency issue, so I started removing everything step by step to test. I removed Artifact Definition, Transformation, Artifact, and even all devices. For some reason, I couldn‚Äôt remove the Transformation file, and the error still remained.

Then I ran sudo docker compose -p infrahub down -v
to reset everything and restarted the setup. The first thing I did was add my Git repository again, but I got the same Import Error. I assumed it was because my main branch was empty, so I created a new branch called branch35 without syncing with Git. I loaded my menu, schema, and simulated data into this new branch, but the error still persisted.

Later, I realized my main branch had already imported the Queries and Transformations files even though there was a sync error, while branch35 did not have them (see screenshot).

With that clue, I loaded the same menu, schema, and simulated data into the main branch, and the sync issue was finally resolved.

What confuses me is that I thought the files (.infrahub.yml, .gpl, .py) in the Git repository integrated with Infrahub were shared across all branches, since the list in the Tasks tab under the Git repository looks the same even when I switch between branches.

So moving forward, if I want to test a new transformation, I think I should create a new branch with Git Sync enabled and edit the .infrahub.yml files in that branch instead. Please correct me if I‚Äôm wrong.
